name: scene
structure: Produces entries for different types of genres and worlds. The 'common' and 'rare' tables are generic and should be compatible with almost any world. To retain compatibility with most settings, the  non-generic tables should be called only from other tables by specifying their name directly.
note: Forked from the Five_room_dungeon generator on 2018-01-04.

tables.name: resolution type
tables.explanation: Ending that ties everything together and possibly paves ground for continuing the story.

entries.v: Happy Ending{var:endheading} Everything turns out fine.
Villain Dies{var:endheading} The villain is dead and cannot threaten anyone anymore.
Villain Surrenders{var:endheading} The villain gives up and surrenders to the {lib:synonym#troupe}.
Villain Escapes{var:endheading} The villain manages to flee from the {lib:synonym#troupe}.
Heroes Captured{var:endheading} The villain manages to capture the {lib:synonym#troupe}. Will they ever be able to escape? That is a different story...
Heroes Escape{var:endheading} The villain attempts to capture the {lib:synonym#troupe}, but they still have a slim chance of escape!
Cliffhanger{var:endheading} A shocking turn takes the {lib:synonym#troupe} by surprise. What will they do? That is a different story...
Greater Threat{var:endheading} A menace much greater than anyone anticipated is revealed!

tables.name: myth
tables.explanation: Scenes once rumoured to have existed.

tables.name: fantasy

tables.explanation: Scenes for modern worlds.

tables.name: futuristic
tables.explanation: Scenes for science fiction worlds.

tables.name: special
tables.explanation: Special scene types.

tables.name: hook encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters solely for starting the adventure.

tables.name: combat encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters with hostile creatures (guardian, minion, monster, beast, rival, etc.)
entries: This is the lair of a {lib:actant#hostile}.
A {lib:actant#hostile} is waiting here, ready to attack.

tables.name: betrayal encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters where the adventurers are betrayed (traitor, shapeshifter, tempter, trickster, etc).

tables.name: trap encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters with traps.
entries: A trap has been set here: {lib:trap#detail}.

tables.name: hazard encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that put the adventurers in danger (hazard, etc.)

tables.name: setback encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that cause the adventurers to lose progress (traitor, shapeshifter, rival, etc).
entries: A {lib:actant#competitive} causes the {lib:synonym#troupe} to lose progress.

tables.name: hindrance encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that slow down, use resources, or otherwise hinder the adventurers (rival, trickster, lock, door, etc).

tables.name: trick encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that require a clever approach.

tables.name: trial encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters where the adventurers must prove themselves (rival, mentor, trickster, etc).
entries: A {lib:actant#friendly} requires the {lib:synonym#troupe} to prove their mettle.

tables.name: competition encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters where adventurers have to compete with someone (rival, mentor, etc.)
entries: A {lib:actant#competitive} presents a challenge to the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: distraction encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that lead astray (shapeshifter, trickster, tempter, traitor, red herring, smoke screen, etc.)

tables.name: sidetrack encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters providing temporary diversion (tricster, tempter, sense of wonder, comic relief, etc.)
entries: A {lib:actant#deceptive} causes a temporary diversion for the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: flavor encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that create color and flavor, may bring roleplaying opportunities (plant, animal, tempter, traitor, item, wonder, etc.)

tables.name: rescue encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters where a prisoner (captive, mentor, ally, shapeshifter, tempter, traitor, trickster, animal, monster, minion, rival, etc.) can be rescued and perhaps befriended.

tables.name: resource encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that offer new resources (artifact, key, tool, treasure, plant, animal, information, red herring, etc.)

tables.name: information encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that offer information (mentor, trickster, clue, shapeshifter, traitor, red herring, etc.)

tables.name: clue
tables.explanation: Hints and tips.
entries: A clue can be found here.

tables.name: help encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters that offer help (mentor, ally, etc.)

tables.name: finale encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters solely for the adventure climax.

tables.name: resolution encounter
tables.explanation: Encounters solely for the adventure resolution.
